title: How to Make Spa Party Invitations

steps.headline: Set the date and time that works best for you.
steps.description: Look carefully at a calendar and make stars on the dates you are, or think you are, available. Ask yourself which day of the week you would like to have it. Weekends would probably work best for your guests, because they may be at school or work during the weekdays. As for the time of day, ask yourself if you want to avoid dinner hour and start in the evening, or go ahead and have your party around lunchtime for a long day full of relaxation. Write down the date and time you chose on a piece of paper. Make sure you stay organized!

steps.headline: Determine the place for the party.
steps.description: You need to think about this. You have the option of having professionals run the event or, if you want to stick with creativity and let your guests feel homey, you can hold your spa party at your house. A large basement works best for a home party, but if you don't have one and really want to set up your spa in a basement, ask a friend who does have one. Big basements allow guests lots of room to switch stations and enjoy themselves.

steps.headline: Figure out the details of your party and write them down.
steps.description: Try to shorten them so that you can put some details on your invitation. What activities are you planning to do? What foods will be served? Is there anything special that your guests need to do or bring?

steps.headline: Double-check your list.
steps.description:
Do you have all details ready? Is the day you picked perfect? Make sure you have these things written on your list:
A date and time the spa party starts and ends. The location of the spa party. Details about the party. Your phone number for the RSVP. Any other additional details about your party.

steps.headline: Get your supplies.
steps.description: You will need hot pink and purple cardstock paper, silver tinsel or pipe cleaners, and a silver permanent marker.

steps.headline: Take the hot pink cardstock and trace the outline of a flip-flop with a pencil.
steps.description: Do the same with the purple. Cut out the shapes.

steps.headline: Attach the flip-flop shapes side-by-side with glue or tape
Attach the tinsel or pipe cleaners where the straps would go.
With the silver marker, write down all of your party details.
Let the girl decorate it with colorful stickers.
Send it out to the guests.
steps.description: Make sure you make enough invitations for each guest.

steps.headline: Get your supplies.
steps.description: You will need to pick two colors that are in your color scheme for the party and buy cardstock in those colors. You will also need Microsoft Word and a printer; relaxing pictures that you have taken or taken from the internet; photo paper; and curled and colorful ribbon.

steps.headline: Put photo paper into the printer and make sure you have lots of each color of ink.
Using Microsoft Word, type up all of your party details (when, where, time, etc.)
steps.description: and add any extra info your guests may need. Use different fonts and colors - experiment and see what you like. Make sure it is centered and the font is big enough.

steps.headline: Print them out.
Glue the photo paper onto the cardstock nice and evenly.
steps.description: Use tape to create a pop-up effect.

steps.headline: You can doodle and make designs along the border.
steps.description: Make it look neat but creative.

steps.headline: Attach pictures with glue or tape.
At the top corners of the paper, attach a small handful of ribbon with a stapler or tape.
Send the invitations to all of your guests!
Get your supplies.
steps.description: You will need Microsoft Word, photo paper, and mini chocolate bars.

steps.headline: Type a soothing, relaxing description of the event in soft colors and it will sound like a dream to your guests.
steps.description: Include soothing images that are neatly placed. Make sure to include all necessary information.

steps.headline: Print them out.
Neatly decorate them.
steps.description: This step is optional, but you can add stickers of martinis and massages. The invitation is the first impression of your spa party.

steps.headline: Put them in envelopes with chocolate bars!
steps.description: Slip the candy in before you seal the envelopes, or tape it to the outside.

steps.headline: Label and distribute the envelopes.

text:
General Party Planning Set the date and time that works best for you. Look carefully at a calendar and make stars on the dates you are, or think you are, available. Ask yourself which day of the week you would like to have it. Weekends would probably work best for your guests, because they may be at school or work during the weekdays. As for the time of day, ask yourself if you want to avoid dinner hour and start in the evening, or go ahead and have your party around lunchtime for a long day full of relaxation. Write down the date and time you chose on a piece of paper. Make sure you stay organized! Determine the place for the party. You need to think about this. You have the option of having professionals run the event or, if you want to stick with creativity and let your guests feel homey, you can hold your spa party at your house. A large basement works best for a home party, but if you don't have one and really want to set up your spa in a basement, ask a friend who does have one. Big basements allow guests lots of room to switch stations and enjoy themselves. Figure out the details of your party and write them down. Try to shorten them so that you can put some details on your invitation. What activities are you planning to do? What foods will be served? Is there anything special that your guests need to do or bring? Double-check your list. Do you have all details ready? Is the day you picked perfect? Make sure you have these things written on your list:
A date and time the spa party starts and ends. The location of the spa party. Details about the party. Your phone number for the RSVP. Any other additional details about your party. Girl Party Invitation (ages 5-9) Get your supplies. You will need hot pink and purple cardstock paper, silver tinsel or pipe cleaners, and a silver permanent marker. Take the hot pink cardstock and trace the outline of a flip-flop with a pencil. Do the same with the purple. Cut out the shapes. Attach the flip-flop shapes side-by-side with glue or tape  Attach the tinsel or pipe cleaners where the straps would go.  With the silver marker, write down all of your party details. Let it dry. Let the girl decorate it with colorful stickers.  Send it out to the guests. Make sure you make enough invitations for each guest. Teen Party Invitation (ages 12-16) Get your supplies. You will need to pick two colors that are in your color scheme for the party and buy cardstock in those colors. You will also need Microsoft Word and a printer; relaxing pictures that you have taken or taken from the internet; photo paper; and curled and colorful ribbon. Put photo paper into the printer and make sure you have lots of each color of ink.  Using Microsoft Word, type up all of your party details (when, where, time, etc.) and add any extra info your guests may need. Use different fonts and colors - experiment and see what you like. Make sure it is centered and the font is big enough. Print them out.  Glue the photo paper onto the cardstock nice and evenly. Use tape to create a pop-up effect. You can doodle and make designs along the border. Make it look neat but creative. Attach pictures with glue or tape.  At the top corners of the paper, attach a small handful of ribbon with a stapler or tape.  Send the invitations to all of your guests!  Girls' Night Out (Adults) Get your supplies. You will need Microsoft Word, photo paper, and mini chocolate bars. Type a soothing, relaxing description of the event in soft colors and it will sound like a dream to your guests. Include soothing images that are neatly placed. Make sure to include all necessary information. Print them out.  Neatly decorate them. This step is optional, but you can add stickers of martinis and massages. The invitation is the first impression of your spa party. Put them in envelopes with chocolate bars! Slip the candy in before you seal the envelopes, or tape it to the outside. Label and distribute the envelopes.
